punchline: Le canal principal, c'est le téléphone du stagiaire.
image_prompt: A confused office worker holding 12 phones, tablets and laptops simultaneously, all showing different sales channels, papers flying everywhere, overwhelmed expression

punchline: La marge aussi, ça fidélise. Ah non, y'en a plus.
image_prompt: A delivery truck driving off a cliff with a big banner saying FREE SHIPPING, the driver looking panicked, coins falling out of the truck

text: On va automatiser le service client.
punchline: Le chatbot répond 'Je n'ai pas compris' depuis 3 mois.
image_prompt: A robot customer service agent at a desk with a speech bubble saying I DONT UNDERSTAND, angry customers in a long queue, cobwebs on the robot

text: Le tunnel de conversion est optimisé.
punchline: 7 étapes, 3 pop-ups, 2 formulaires et un captcha.
image_prompt: A person trying to navigate through a literal tunnel obstacle course with pop-up walls, forms as hurdles, and a captcha puzzle at the end, shopping cart abandoned at entrance

punchline: On spamme. Mais en anglais, ça fait mieux.
image_prompt: A person at a computer sending thousands of spam emails, wearing a cool hoodie and sunglasses, the screen showing GROWTH HACKER title, trash bin overflowing with unsubscribe requests

punchline: Sur la fibre du bureau. Pas sur la 4G du client.
image_prompt: Split scene: left side shows a developer on super fast fiber connection with a rocket, right side shows a customer on mobile with a loading spinner and a snail on the phone

text: On a mis en place un programme de fidélité.
punchline: 1 point par euro. Le premier cadeau à 47 000 points.
image_prompt: An elderly person with a very long beard holding a loyalty card showing 46999 points, looking at a tiny keychain as the reward, gift shop behind with extravagant prizes behind glass

punchline: Le client a commandé 5 tailles. Il en garde zéro.
image_prompt: A mountain of returned packages at a warehouse, a single customer walking away with nothing, warehouse workers overwhelmed by the pile of boxes

text: On a besoin d'une app mobile.
punchline: 12 téléchargements. Dont 8 par l'équipe.
image_prompt: A giant phone showing a download counter at 12, a team of 8 developers each downloading it on their own phones, looking proud, one lonely real customer in the background

punchline: Sur mobile, le bouton Acheter est sous le footer.
image_prompt: A person scrolling endlessly on a tiny phone screen, the Buy button visible way below the footer text and copyright, finger stretching impossibly far down

text: On a un plan de reprise d'activité.
punchline: Le plan c'est : appeler le prestataire en panique.
image_prompt: A server room on fire, a panicked person holding a phone with CALLING VENDOR on screen, a document titled DISASTER PLAN with only one line written on it

punchline: Mot de passe admin : admin123.
image_prompt: A massive vault door wide open, with a tiny post-it note on it showing password admin123, a hacker casually walking in with a coffee

punchline: Google Translate fait le job. — Non.
image_prompt: A website showing hilariously wrong machine translations on product pages, confused international customers with flags of different countries looking at nonsense text

punchline: Formation de 3 jours pour ajouter un produit.
image_prompt: A person sitting in a classroom for DAY 3 of training, looking exhausted, the whiteboard showing HOW TO ADD A PRODUCT with incredibly complex flowcharts and arrows

punchline: L'IA recommande des cercueils après un achat de fleurs.
image_prompt: A customer looking horrified at a website recommending coffins and funeral services after buying flowers, the AI engine looking proud with a thumbs up

text: Le stock est synchronisé en temps réel.
punchline: Temps réel = une fois par nuit, si le cron ne plante pas.
image_prompt: Two clocks side by side, one showing NOW, the other showing LAST NIGHT, a warehouse worker confused between the two, products appearing and disappearing like ghosts

punchline: Le prix barré était déjà le prix soldé.
image_prompt: A price tag showing a crossed-out price of 49.99 replaced by a NEW price of 49.99, a customer squinting at it with a magnifying glass

punchline: Si on oublie les 4% de daltoniens et les lecteurs d'écran.
image_prompt: A website with red text on green background, no alt tags shown as empty frames, a person with a screen reader getting only BUTTON BUTTON IMAGE IMAGE, confused face

punchline: On supprime les mauvais, on garde les 5 étoiles de mamie.
image_prompt: A person at a computer deleting 1-star reviews with a big eraser, only 5-star reviews remaining, all from GRANDMA, an old lady giving thumbs up in the corner

punchline: Il a été racheté 3 fois depuis la signature.
image_prompt: A business handshake but the partner keeps changing identity - three different company logos overlapping, confused project manager holding a contract with crossed-out names

punchline: Elle date de 2019. Personne ne sait où elle est.
image_prompt: A dusty old scroll labeled ROADMAP 2019 in an archaeological dig site, a person blowing dust off it, cobwebs everywhere, modern laptops visible in the background

punchline: Sauf les 47 demandes hors périmètre qu'on a acceptées.
image_prompt: A fence labeled PROJECT SCOPE with dozens of requests climbing over it, under it, and around it, a project manager trying to hold the fence but it is collapsing

punchline: Le colis est prêt. Le magasin ferme dans 5 minutes.
image_prompt: A customer sprinting toward a store with a CLOSING sign, holding a phone showing ORDER READY, store employee turning off lights and locking the door

text: Le dashboard est mis à jour.
punchline: Il montre les chiffres de mars. On est en novembre.
image_prompt: A big screen showing a dashboard proudly labeled MARCH DATA, a calendar on the wall clearly showing NOVEMBER, executives nodding approvingly at outdated graphs

punchline: Taux d'ouverture 60%. Parce qu'on s'envoie les tests entre nous.
image_prompt: An email dashboard showing 60% open rate, zoom into the recipients list showing only internal team emails, colleagues high-fiving each other

punchline: Il gère aussi 4 autres projets, le support et la compta.
image_prompt: A person splitting into 5 copies of themselves, each at a different desk doing different tasks (support headset, calculator, scrum board, emails, phone), all looking exhausted

punchline: Le POC est en prod depuis 2 ans.
image_prompt: A small cardboard prototype labeled POC with tape and glue holding a massive building (labeled PRODUCTION) on top of it, everything wobbling dangerously

punchline: Un stagiaire, un fichier Excel et beaucoup d'espoir.
image_prompt: A lone intern at a desk with a single laptop showing Excel, a tiny sign behind saying DATA TEAM, an enormous pile of unprocessed data papers surrounding them

text: Le projet est en méthode agile.
punchline: Sprint de 2 semaines. Réunion de planification : 3 jours.
image_prompt: A sprint board showing a 2-week sprint, but the PLANNING column takes up 80% of the board, tiny DOING and DONE columns squeezed at the end, team in endless meeting

punchline: Les délais ont été rallongés 4 fois. Techniquement, c'est vrai.
image_prompt: A timeline on a whiteboard that has been erased and redrawn 4 times, each deadline pushed further, the final date circled triumphantly with DONE ON TIME written next to it

punchline: On a perdu 80% du trafic. Mais le site est plus joli.
image_prompt: A beautiful shiny new website on a pedestal, but a traffic graph plummeting off a cliff behind it, an SEO person crying while a designer celebrates

text: Le contenu, c'est le client qui le fournit.
punchline: Le client a fourni un PDF scanné de travers en 72 dpi.
image_prompt: A developer staring at a terrible pixelated scanned PDF on screen, tilted at 45 degrees, barely readable, client on phone saying THATS OUR BEST VERSION

text: On va tout connecter via API.
punchline: L'ERP du client date de 2003. Il communique par fax.
image_prompt: A modern API connector trying to plug into an ancient ERP computer from 2003, the old computer has a fax machine attached, paper printouts everywhere, smoke coming out

text: Les tests de charge ont été faits.
punchline: Avec 3 utilisateurs. En même temps c'est tout le trafic qu'on a.
image_prompt: A load testing dashboard showing 3 CONCURRENT USERS with a big green checkmark, a graph showing the total site traffic is also exactly 3 people

punchline: 147 doublons, 83 produits sans prix et un article test nommé 'aaa'.
image_prompt: A product catalog screen showing duplicate entries, products named TEST AAA and COPY OF COPY, prices showing $0.00 and NaN, a cat photo as product image

punchline: On veut un truc moderne mais classique, audacieux mais sobre.
image_prompt: A designer tearing their hair out reading a brief that says MODERN BUT CLASSIC, BOLD BUT SUBTLE, INNOVATIVE BUT TRADITIONAL, contradicting arrows everywhere

punchline: Il plante les jours de promo. Les seuls jours où il sert.
image_prompt: A website working perfectly on a normal empty day, then exploding and crashing when a SALE banner appears, error 503 pages everywhere, customers lined up outside

text: Le client a validé les maquettes.
punchline: Il a validé sans regarder. Il découvre en recette.
image_prompt: A client signing a mockup document while looking at their phone not paying attention, then later looking shocked at the actual website saying THIS IS NOT WHAT I WANTED

punchline: Sur Fiverr. Budget : le prix d'un kebab.
image_prompt: A beautiful design brief going into a machine labeled FIVERR 5 DOLLARS, coming out the other side as a terrible clipart mess, a kebab receipt pinned to the invoice

punchline: Si on ignore les 4 redirections, 2 erreurs 404 et la page blanche.
image_prompt: A customer journey map that looks like a maze with dead ends labeled 404, redirect arrows going in circles, and a blank white page at the end, customer lost in the middle

punchline: On a regardé leur site une fois, un vendredi soir.
image_prompt: A person casually browsing a competitor website on Friday evening with a beer, a document titled COMPETITIVE ANALYSIS with only one bullet point, checked off as DONE

punchline: Le serveur est dimensionné pour 50 visiteurs. On en espère 50 000.
image_prompt: A tiny server the size of a shoebox with a sign saying READY FOR 50K VISITORS, a massive crowd of 50000 people approaching, the server sweating and smoking

punchline: Il gère surtout son planning de réunions.
image_prompt: A project manager calendar showing back-to-back meetings from 8am to 6pm every day, no actual work time, the project tasks piling up untouched on the desk

punchline: 3 likes, 0 vente, 1 commentaire de mamie.
image_prompt: A social media post of a product with 3 likes, 0 sales, and one comment from GRANDMA saying VERY NICE DEAR, the social media manager celebrating the engagement

punchline: Le logo change tous les 6 mois. Personne ne nous reconnaît.
image_prompt: A wall showing 6 different versions of a company logo from the last 3 years, each completely different style, customers walking past with confused faces not recognizing any

punchline: Par le développeur back-end. Un mardi soir. Vite fait.
image_prompt: A backend developer hastily sketching a terrible UI on a napkin at night, code editor open behind them, the resulting interface has buttons everywhere in random sizes and colors

punchline: On suit le nombre de pages vues. C'est tout.
image_prompt: A massive analytics dashboard with only one metric highlighted: PAGE VIEWS, all other important metrics grayed out and ignored, the manager pointing proudly at the one number

text: Le site est prêt pour le Black Friday.
punchline: Le Black Friday, c'est demain. Le site, c'est pas demain.
image_prompt: A calendar showing BLACK FRIDAY TOMORROW, next to a website showing UNDER CONSTRUCTION with scaffolding, developers panicking and coding frantically

punchline: Le process c'est : on livre, on croise les doigts.
image_prompt: A quality assurance flowchart with only two steps: DEPLOY and PRAY, a person with crossed fingers pushing a big red deploy button, a candle lit next to the server

punchline: Validé. Puis coupé de moitié. Puis re-validé. Puis gelé.
image_prompt: A budget document being cut with scissors, glued back, cut again, frozen in a block of ice, and stamped APPROVED, a finance person looking confused

text: On a tout documenté sur Confluence.
punchline: 42 pages. Toutes obsolètes. Aucune retrouvable.
image_prompt: A Confluence-like wiki page showing LAST UPDATED 2 YEARS AGO, search results returning 42 pages all marked OUTDATED, a person lost in a maze of wiki links

punchline: Full-stack : il fait tout, mal, tout seul.
image_prompt: A single developer juggling frontend code, backend code, database, devops, design and coffee simultaneously, everything dropping and breaking, wearing a cape labeled FULL STACK

punchline: 4 mois de développement. Pour un bouton.
image_prompt: A tiny button on a webpage, behind it a massive iceberg showing 4 months of development, meetings, specs, code reviews, and testing below the surface

punchline: On dit ça depuis 3 mois.
image_prompt: A wall calendar with GO LIVE TOMORROW written on every single day for the past 3 months, each one crossed out, a new one written on today

punchline: Marketing veut du rose, IT veut du bleu, le CEO veut les deux.
image_prompt: Three teams pulling a website design in different directions like tug of war: MARKETING team pulling toward pink, IT pulling toward blue, CEO in the middle wanting both, site tearing apart

punchline: Le ROI est négatif. On a arrêté de le mesurer.
image_prompt: A ROI graph going deeply negative, a hand reaching in and turning the chart upside down so it looks positive, everyone clapping in a meeting

punchline: Il est en liquidation judiciaire depuis mardi.
image_prompt: A vendor shaking hands with a client, behind the vendor a courthouse with BANKRUPTCY FILED sign, moving trucks taking away office furniture

punchline: Version 47.3.12-hotfix-final-FINAL-v2.
image_prompt: A version number on screen reading v47.3.12-hotfix-final-FINAL-v2, a developer adding yet another patch, a tower of patches stacked precariously like Jenga blocks

text: Le prochain projet, on fera mieux.
punchline: On a dit ça au projet d'avant. Et à celui d'encore avant.
image_prompt: A line of identical failed projects stretching into the distance, each with a sign NEXT TIME WELL DO BETTER, a new project at the front with the exact same sign, cycle repeating forever
